Clearly, , can check using JavaScript: Great! image hidden indicated FALSE. can hide executing simple JavaScript. now image hidden. used element given id = "hplogo". use JavaScript function getElementById access . nicer used webElem specified earlier. pass webElement object argument either executeScript executeAsyncScript, RSelenium pass appropriate fashion. title: Basics
text: briefly touch async versus sync calls . Firstly, need set appropriate asynchronous timeout (longer async operation likely carryout, ensure eventually error case issue). Observe: Versus async version waits callback (defined last argument arguments[arguments.length - 1] JavaScript zero-indexed) called whereas sync version returns straight away. cases, Google logo disappears five seconds.
code: remDr$navigate("http://www.google.com/ncr") remDr$setAsyncScriptTimeout(10000) webElem <- remDr$findElement("css", "img#hplogo") script <- " cb = arguments[arguments.length -1]; webElem = arguments[0]; setTimeout(function(){webElem.hidden = true; cb('DONE');},5000);" remDr$executeAsyncScript(script, args = list(webElem)) remDr$navigate("http://www.google.com/ncr") webElem <- remDr$findElement("css", "img#hplogo") script <- " webElem = arguments[0]; setTimeout(function(){webElem.hidden = true;},5000); return 'DONE'; " remDr$executeScript(script, args = list(webElem))

The Comprehensive R Archive Network

Download and Install R

Precompiled binary distributions of the base system and contributed packages, Windows and Mac users most likely want one of these versions of R:
  • Download R for Linux
  • Download R for (Mac) OS X
  • Download R for Windows
R is part of many Linux distributions, you should check with your Linux package management system in addition to the link above.
................ ................ ................

Questions About R

  • If you have questions about R like how to download and install the software, or what the license terms are, please read our answers to frequently asked questions before you send an email.

What are R and CRAN?

R is GNU, a freely available language and environment for statistical computing and graphics which provides a wide variety of statistical and graphical techniques: linear and nonlinear modelling, statistical tests, time series analysis, classification, clustering, etc. Please consult the R project homepage for further information.

CRAN is a network of ftp and web servers around the world that store identical, up-to-date, versions of code and documentation for R. Please use the CRAN mirror nearest to you to minimize network load.

Submitting to CRAN

To submit a package to CRAN, check that your submission meets the CRAN Repository Policy and then use the web form.

If this fails, upload to ftp://CRAN.R-project.org/incoming/ and send an email to CRAN@R-project.org following the policy. Please do not attach submissions to emails, because this will clutter up the mailboxes of half a dozen people.

Note that we generally do not accept submissions of precompiled binaries due to security reasons. All binary distribution listed above are compiled by selected maintainers, who are in charge for all binaries of their platform, respectively.

This message shows that your installation appears to be working correctly.  To generate this message, Docker took the following steps:  1. The Docker client contacted the Docker daemon.  2. The Docker daemon streamed that output to the Docker client, which sent it     to your terminal. title: Driving OS/Browsers Local and Remote
text: assume vignette setting Sauce Labs open source project. Firstly register project . account page find access key account similar format 49953c74-5c46-4ff9-b584-cf31a4c71809. Using Sauce Labs pretty straightforward. need tell OS/Browser combination like. list possible setups can viewed . example lets suppose wished run google chrome version 33 OSX version mavericks. state browser OS require (chrome 33/ Mac OSX 10.9). user password used form appropriate ip address remote server (http://rselenium0:49953c74-5c46-4ff9-b584-cf31a4c71809@ondemand.saucelabs.com case). also passed extraCapabilities remote Selenium server. give test name additional tags wish passed remote Selenium server. Details name tags given . used annotate tests.
code: require(RSelenium) user <- "rselenium0" # Your Sauce Labs username pass <- "49953c74-5c46-4ff9-b584-cf31a4c71809" # Your Sauce Labs access key  port <- 80 ip <- paste0(user, ':', pass, "@ondemand.saucelabs.com") rdBrowser <- "chrome" version <- "33" platform <- "OS X 10.9" extraCapabilities <- list(   name = "RSelenium OS/Browsers vignette first example",   username = user,   accessKey = pass,   tags = list("RSelenium-vignette", "OS/Browsers-vignette") ) remDr <- remoteDriver$new(   remoteServerAddr = ip,   port = port,   browserName = rdBrowser,   version = version,   platform = platform,   extraCapabilities = extraCapabilities )

title: Driving OS/Browsers Local and Remote
text: opened shinytestapp port 3000 Sauce Connect supports set number ports. ports can used need locally-defined domain name (can set hosts file) rather localhost. simple purposes vignette shall connect http://localhost:3000. start shall use Mavericks Chrome 33. port <- 80ip <- paste0(user, ‘:’, pass, “@ondemand.saucelabs.com”) Everything exception ask browse localhost address Sauce Connect intervene. Also connect Sauce Labs Sauce Connect localhost:4445 default instead ondemand.saucelabs.com:80.
code: require(RSelenium) user <- "rselenium0" # Your Sauce Labs username pass <- "49953c74-5c46-4ff9-b584-cf31a4c71809" # Your Sauce Labs access key port <- 4445 ip <- paste0(user, ':', pass, "@localhost") rdBrowser <- "firefox" version <- "26" platform <- "Linux" extraCapabilities <- list(   name = "RSelenium OS/Browsers vignette second example",   username = user,   accessKey = pass,   tags = list(     "RSelenium-vignette",     "OS/Browsers-vignette",     "Example 2"   ) ) remDr <- remoteDriver$new(   remoteServerAddr = ip,   port = port,   browserName = rdBrowser,   version = version,   platform = platform,   extraCapabilities = extraCapabilities ) localScript <- function(remDr){   remDr$open()   remDr$setImplicitWaitTimeout(2000) # wait for elements for 2 seconds   remDr$navigate("http://localhost:3000")   Sys.sleep(2)   # highlight the labels   webElems <- remDr$findElements("css selector", "#ctrlSelect span")   lapply(webElems, function(x) {x$highlightElement()})   Sys.sleep(2)   appIds <- c("summary", "distPlot", "ggPlot", "dttable")   # Click each checkbox and check for its output   lapply(seq_along(webElems), function(x) {     if(!webElems[[x]]$isElementSelected()[[1]]) {       webElems[[x]]$clickElement()       # test for its output       out <- remDr$findElement("id", appIds[x])       out$highlightElement()     }   })      remDr$close() }  localScript(remDr)

title: CLASS errorHandler — errorHandler-class
text: statusCodes list status codes descriptions. status status code summarizing result command. non-zero value indicates command failed. value one failure may  indicate problem. statusclass Class associated java library underlying server. Example: org.openqa.selenium.remote.Response sessionid opaque handle used server determine route session-specific commands. ID included future session-commands place :sessionId path segment variable. hcode list value list containing detailed information regarding possible errors: message: descriptive message command     failure. screen: string   (Optional) included,     screenshot current page base64 encoded string. class: string   (Optional) included, specifies     fully qualified class name exception thrown     command failed. stackTrace: array   (Optional) included,     specifies array JSON objects describing stack trace     exception thrown command failed.     zeroth element array represents top stack. responseheader two levels error handling specified    wire protocol: invalid requests failed commands.    Invalid Requests probably indicted status 1. invalid requests result server returning 4xx HTTP    response. response Content-Type set text/plain    message body descriptive error message.    categories invalid requests follows: Unknown Commands: server receives command request whose path mapped        resource REST service, respond 404        Found message. Unimplemented Commands: Every server implementing WebDriver wire protocol must        respond every defined command. individual command        implemented server, server respond        501 Implemented error message. Note        error Invalid Request category return 4xx        status code. Variable Resource Found: request path maps variable resource, resource        exist, server respond 404        Found. example, ID -session valid session ID        server, command sent GET /session/-session        HTTP/1.1, server gracefully return 404. Invalid Command Method: request path maps valid resource, resource        respond request method, server        respond 405 Method Allowed. response must include        Allows header list allowed methods        requested resource. Missing Command Parameters: POST/PUT command maps resource expects set        JSON parameters, response body include one        parameters, server respond 400 Bad        Request. response body list missing parameters. debugheader currently implemented

Defaults "/wd/hub" version Object class "character". browser version, empty string unknown. platform Object class "character". key specifying platform browser running . value one WINDOWS|XP|VISTA|MAC|LINUX|UNIX. requesting new session, client may specify indicate available platform may used. javascript Object class "logical". Whether session supports native events. n WebDriver advanced user interactions provided either simulating Javascript events directly (.e. synthetic events) letting browser generate Javascript events (.e. native events). title: CLASS remoteDriver — remoteDriver-class
code: if (FALSE) { # use default server initialisation values remDr <- remoteDriver$new()  # send request to server to initialise session remDr$open()  # navigate to R home page remDr$navigate("http://www.r-project.org")  # navigate to www.bbc.co.uk notice the need for http:// remDr$navigate("http://www.bbc.co.uk")  # go backwards and forwards remDr$goBack()  remDr$goForward()  remDr$goBack()  # Examine the page source frontPage <- remDr$getPageSource()  # The R homepage contains frames webElem <- remDr$findElements(value = "//frame") sapply(webElem, function(x) {   x$getElementAttribute("name") })  # The homepage contains 3 frames: logo, contents and banner # switch to the `contents` frame webElem <- remDr$findElement(using = "name", value = "contents") remDr$switchToFrame(webElem$elementId)  # re-examine the page source  contentPage <- remDr$getPageSource() identical(contentPage, frontPage) # false we hope!!  # Find the link for the search page on R homepage. Use xpath as default. webElem <- remDr$findElement(value = '//a[@href = "search.html"]') webElem$getElementAttribute("href") # http://www.r-project.org/search.html  # click the search link webElem$clickElement()  # FILL OUT A GOOGLE SEARCH FORM remDr$navigate("http://www.google.com")  # show different methods of accessing DOM components  webElem1 <- remDr$findElement(using = "name", value = "q") webElem2 <- remDr$findElement(   using = "id",   value = webElem1$getElementAttribute("id")[[1]] ) webElem3 <- remDr$findElement(   using = "xpath",   value = '//input[@name = "q"]' )  # Enter some text in the search box  webElem1$sendKeysToElement(list("RSelenium was here"))  # clear the text previously entered  webElem1$clearElement()  # show an example of sending a key press webElem1$sendKeysToElement(list("R", key = "enter"))  # Collate the results for the `R` search googLinkText <- remDr$findElements(value = "//h3[@class = 'r']") linkHeading <- sapply(googLinkText, function(x) x$getElementText()) googLinkDesc <- remDr$findElements(value = "//div[@class = 's']") linkDescription <- sapply(googLinkDesc, function(x) x$getElementText()) googLinkHref <- remDr$findElements(value = "//h3[@class = 'r']/a") linkHref <- sapply(   googLinkHref,   function(x) x$getElementAttribute("href") )  data.frame(   heading = linkHeading,   description = linkDescription, href = linkHref )  # Example of javascript call remDr$executeScript("return arguments[0] + arguments[1];", args = 1:2) # Example of javascript async call jsscript <-   "arguments[arguments.length - 1](arguments[0] + arguments[1]);" remDr$executeAsyncScript(jsscript, args = 1:2)  # EXAMPLE INJECTING INTO PHANTOMJS using phantomExecute require(RSelenium) pJS <- wdman::phantomjs(port = 4932L) remDr <- remoteDriver(browserName = "phantomjs", port = 4932L) remDr$open(silent = TRUE) remDr$navigate("http://ariya.github.com/js/random/") # returns a set of random numbers remDr$findElement("id", "numbers")$getElementText()[[1]] #  # now try injecting a new Math,random function result <- remDr$phantomExecute("var page = this;                                page.onInitialized = function () {                                page.evaluate(function () {                                Math.random = function() {return 42/100}                                })                                }", list()) remDr$navigate("http://ariya.github.com/js/random/") # Math.random returns our custom function remDr$findElement("id", "numbers")$getElementText()[[1]] remDr$close() pJS$stop() }

text: clearElement() Clear TEXTAREA text INPUT element's value. clickElement() Click element. compareElements(otherElem) Test current webElement web element refer DOM element. describeElement() Describe identified element. findChildElement(   using = c("xpath", "css selector", "id", "name", "tag name", "class name", "link text",     "partial link text"),   value ) Search element page, starting node defined parent webElement. located element returned object webElement class. inputs : using: Locator scheme use search     element, available schemes: "class name", "css selector",     "id", "name", "link text", "partial link text",     "tag name", "xpath" . See examples. findChildElements(   using = c("xpath", "css selector", "id", "name", "tag name", "class name", "link text",     "partial link text"),   value ) Search multiple elements page, starting node defined parent webElement. located elements returned list objects class WebElement. inputs : using: Locator scheme use search     element, available schemes: "class name", "css selector",     "id", "name", "link text", "partial link text",     "tag name", "xpath" . Defaults 'xpath'.     Partial string matching accepted. value: search target. See examples. getElementAttribute(attrName) Get value element's attribute. See examples. getElementLocation() Determine element's location page. point (0, 0) refers upper-left corner page. getElementLocationInView() Determine element's location screen scrolled view. Note: considered internal command used determine element's location correctly generating native events. getElementSize() Determine element's size pixels. size returned width height properties. getElementTagName() Query element's tag name. getElementText() Get innerText element. getElementValueOfCssProperty(propName) Query value element's computed CSS property. CSS property query specified using CSS property name, JavaScript property name (e.g. background-color instead backgroundColor). highlightElement(wait = 75/1000) Utility function highlight current Element. Wait denotes time seconds style changes element. isElementDisplayed() Determine element currently displayed. isElementEnabled() Determine element currently enabled. Obviously enable element just preform click . isElementSelected() Determine OPTION element, INPUT element type checkbox radiobutton currently selected. selectTag() Utility function return options select DOM node. option nodes returned webElements. option text value option attribute 'value' whether option selected returned also. method called webElement select DOM node error result. sendKeysToElement(sendKeys) Send sequence key strokes element. key strokes sent list. Plain text enter unnamed element list. Keyboard entries defined `selKeys` listed name `key`. See examples. setElementAttribute(attributeName, value) Utility function set elements attributes. submitElement() Submit FORM element. submit command may also applied element descendant FORM element.
